Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: neermalanaidoo
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly, in-house restaurant, walk to ferry to take you across the spice & gold souk, saravana's eating place and others in the vicinity, near the train and bus station. I took the bus to Ferrari World and back. You can buy a train or bus ticket and travel 'cause the cab fares to the malls were expensive.

Reviews.Title: “An average to poor hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: geodive
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in this hotel courtesy Emirates air company. This can be the only reason for someone to pick this hotel for his stay in Dubai. Upon arrival the receptionist was "doing us a favor" to check our group in. At the first floor of the hotel, a night club -full of "working" girls- was hammering the walls with its dance music. The echo of this noise was present in my 2nd floor room. The room was just ok for this hotel category. The breakfast simple but decent.

Reviews.Title: “DECENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SMTOUSEEF
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at a very good location. only issue faced was of security deposit.. I had traveled through Thomas cook...they told me that i need not to pay any thing at hotel from my pocket and it is a all inclusive package.. and when i checked in.. hotel people were asking for 100 USD as a security deposit... it took 2 days for thomas cook and hotel management to clear the issue... till then hotel had kept our passports which they should have not done... these administrative issues should be taken care by both travel agency and hotel...at the same time other people with different travel operators did not face this issue... Break fast was good... markets are near by and at walkable distance.... Bur Dubai bus stop is also walkable...

Reviews.Title: “MEETS THE STANDARD”
Reviews.Author: El G
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: Howard Johnson Hotel-Bur Dubai is a fairly average hotel. It is a slightly older property in comparison to other prominent hotels I’ve stayed at in Dubai. The hotel is somewhat outdated yet, clean and accommodating. TRAVEL DATES: May-2011 LOCATION: Situated in Bur Dubai approximately 20 minutes from Dubai Airport (DXB), at the intersection of Khalid Bin Waleed Street& Jumeirah Beach Road. Gold souks, Electronic shopping district, and other shopping opportunities are a 10 minute taxi ride. POSITIVE NOTES: Good views of Dubai Port & Customs; Friendly staff; Clean Rooms; Good Customer Service. NEGATIVE NOTES: Surcharge applies for Wi-Fi access. Although the fitness center has a bigger illusion in the picture, it is actually a single room size gym. The fitness center and the small pool are located on the top floor. No in-room safe to store my passport. AMENITIES: Continental breakfast, Wi-Fi Access (surcharge apply), Mini-Bar; Coffee Maker, Hairdryer, Clock/Radio, Outdoor Pool, Fitness Center, On-Site Restaurant. NIGHTLY RATE: $75+ with corporate discount DISCOUNT ACCEPTED: Corporate Discount. (Must be booked online) NOTES: Please click the green “YES” button below if you find this review helpful. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Not good hotel as expected”
Reviews.Author: canan c
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed at this hotel last week (11-19 of February 2012) First they did not supply us for wireless internet even on their webpage was informed free wireless in the lobby area. To have wireless we had to pay 10 Dirham per hour. We had bad experience when they promised us to open the swimming pool for 2 hours in the morning only for women and unfortunately they did not. Also rooms were small. And there were no thé kitchen either! 4 star hotel Howard Johnson hotel did not live up tp 4 star! So please select another hotel with 5 starts hotel. Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Best in Class for Quality, Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Pecobianajay
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the hotel during DSF for 5 days with family, Very conveniently located to major shopping places. Being in Bur Dubai every thing like Gold Souq, Heritage Village, Carefour , New Gold Souq, Burjman Mall, City Mall, major electronic outlestd are just five minutes drive, 10DHM taxi drive to any of the location. In walking diatnce to hotel the only market where you can negotiate in Dubai is there i.e. Meena Bazzar. Bothe Green and Red Channel Metro Station is closely Located. Every other minutes you will get taxi or Bus. The staff is courteous but Guys who want to fill belly for whole day with breakfast to save your DHM for shopping then not a good option. The breakfast in not at all good. The view specially from our room i.e. at 7th floor was simply outstanding. The window was opening with Burj Khalifa in View and Sea jus some steps away. Good Hotel to stay, will hope some more improvement as very recent Howard Johnson has takeover this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hchavan
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and thought to review it. Pros: 1) Located in Bur Dubai near some of the major shopping areas like Gould Souq , Meena bazaar etc 2) Good clean rooms with mini bar facility 3) Has Indian restaurant Kebab Corner that serves good Indian food 4) Polite and friendly staff 5) OK breakfast Cons: 1) Sometimes noise from clubs below comes in the rooms even on the top floor 2) No free Wifi

Reviews.Title: “Only one thing”
Reviews.Author: kashifnisar
Reviews.Content: There is only one club inside (dawat) u can enjoy only this. Good dance stuff. But in the hotel service is very poor no helpfull staff nothing.

Reviews.Title: “one night - pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: kmelectric
Reviews.Content: We were given a pre-cruise night in this hotel, as its fairly near the port ( we looked out of our window at the docks - maybe half a mile away.) Due to the flight arrival time, we didn`t arrive at the hotel until the early hours of the morning - but it was quick & painless to check in, and be shown to the room. After a (very) quick sort-out, it was off to bed - bed was hard, but comfortable. Room was well organised, with tea and coffee facilities at hand. Breakfast was ok - nothing really special, but perfectly acceptable. The foyer area makes the place look "dingier" than it really is, but maybe that was just me. The room is accessible, with fairly good views across Bur Dubai. I can`t say much more about the facilities, etc; as we didn`t use them - although every member of staff we met was pleasant, polite and friendly (par for the course in Dubai, in my experience!) I`d stay there again, for a day or two; but the traffic noise is quite bad to the front of the building - the rear is quieter; but you`ll be looking at the next building across an alleyway! Given the choice, I`ll have a view.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: kmeWales
Reviews.Content: We were only here for 1 night pre-cruise , but it was perfectly situated for a short taxi ride to the port . clean , large room, helpful staff & a view of the queen mary docked at port rashid . only slight niggle was the noise of the traffic , not the hotel`s fault , just a very busy road .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: UmbrianContadino
Reviews.Content: Booked through Emirates but not up to the high standard that the airline provides. Convenient for the souk and creek area but distant from beaches and malls. Room was OK but rather dated. Gym had limited facilities and Pool area needed updating, limited number of loungers some of which were broken.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to DXB”
Reviews.Author: alyniang
Reviews.Content: Very nice & cool hotel located at Bur Dubai , nearest the port !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VijayKumawat
Reviews.Content: good hotel in affordable range, situated at centre of Dubai, close to main attaractions. all services and entertaintment available; breakfast provided quality is not that much good. Not much expensive

Reviews.Title: “Staff Steals from Bags”
Reviews.Author: Rajan J
Reviews.Content: hello, we were a big group , who had booked 11 rooms for 7 nights each... over all the ambience and the rooms of the hotel were very nice.... BUT, we had done shopping of small things each day , when we started packing the last day for check out, we all came to know that some small things were missing from each of our rooms,. on checkout we did complain to the reception, but the guy at the reception was just not ready to listen to the same and denied that it cant happen. if it happens in all rooms, THEN IT IS FOR SURE THAT THERE ARE THIEVES IN THE HOTEL STAFF, WHO ENTER OUR ROOM FOR CLEANING AND STEAL STUFF. they are even harsh on dening rooms on higher floors even if they have as we had book earlier , we could do nothing despite requesting them earlier by email for higher floor rooms people going here , pls be cautioned for your stuff....its gets stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money....business class service @ economy class rates.”
Reviews.Author: molak20287
Reviews.Content: Located in the old part of dubai, the hotel is pretty much new. Has a nice small reception with a warm staff and a nice lounge type sitting area for guests. Cramped for space it still has utilised it fairly good. Its location is quite good. Facing the harbour and on the starting of the khalid bin waleed road, it commands a nice view from the roof top of the queen elizabeth 2 berthed at port rashid and the bur dubai skyline. There is a gym and pool at the top which though are small but adequate. Rooms are nice and have huge bay windows giving nice views Two restaurents. Both again cramped for space but provide nice quality food. Indian food is nice and morning breakfast is also yummy. Travel desk and reception both were very helpful. Room rates vary but fairly ok. As a whole its a certified 3 star as stated on the main entrance but cramped for space. Good for a 2-3 day stay for small families and perfect for businessmen. Its firstclass service in economy class seats. Has changed name recently from hotel highlands so taxi drivers are pretty clueless about it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: globe_trotter_5519
Reviews.Content: Very nicely located. Staff is very friendly right from the porter till the Manager. TheIndian restaurant Kebab Corner serves amazing Indian cuisine accompanied with live hindi music and ghazals. The night club is lively. Well appointed rooms with all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: girgray
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at Hotel Howard Johnson - Bur Dubai think again. The service is average and nothing great. Cleaning of rooms is a problem as our room was not cleaned for two to three days inspite of complaining. Nevertheless rooms are tidy.The pool facility is not great but again the price is not too much. Breakfast buffet is not bad.If you want high quality treatment, its better to choose other hotels. The positive side is: its economical.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean place to stay, helpful, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: sarahjharrison
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a stopover on the Emirates website and they were really good at greeting us at the airport, with a welcome pack and took us to the hotel. The staff there were friendly and helpful most of the time. Tidy clean room, air conditioning working well,(actually turned it up a bit!) the only snag was we booked a room with a double bed and got two singles, they did say we could push them together! clean shower and toilets. view wasn't much but didn't expect one. One thing we thought was free was the check in/out changes. If you check in early, say 7am then you have to check out at 7am on the day you are due to leave, otherwise they charge you extra to stay longer. The location was ok, we generally got taxis to go somewhere and they were very good at hailing them for you while you waited in the cool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Helpful Staff, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: mbakrania
Reviews.Content: Mainly chose to stay here for it inexpensive prices. The room I had was nice and quite spacious, with a mini bar, Flat screen TV, Queen size bed. Overall it was clean and presentable. Hotel Staff very helpful and friendly. There is a pool and Jacuzzi on the rooftop. The area where the hotel is situated is an ‘Indian quarter’ part of Dubai, it has also a lot electronics/computer shops as well as ‘cheap eats’ restaurants/take away. Also the main road seems to be congested most of the time. The nearest metro is a short cab ride away (but taxis/buses/metro are very cheap). I admit it is a little bit further out to the main attractions. But I really did enjoy my stay here. And I would recommend others to give this hotel a go if you are visiting on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal.”
Reviews.Author: st_mike407
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through the Emirates Air stopover program. On a side note, the Emirates Air stopover program is a great deal. Someone meets you at the airport, drives you to your hotel, and then picks you up for your return to the airport. So, the Howard Johnson Bur Dubai is a good option in Dubai. The rooms were great, sparkling clean, and comfortable. We had a problem with the air conditioning in one room, and they immediately moved us to another room. The service in the hotel overall was very good. There is a travel desk in the lobby that can help you make arrangements for tours of the other emirates, or give advice on how to get around in Dubai. The front desk staff was extremely helpful with all of our question. Breakfast is included, and offers a range of western and Indian food. There is a gym in the hotel, and there is a pool in the roof, which is a nice option, considering how hot it can get in Dubai. The location of the hotel is in Bur Dubai, which is in the older section of the city. It's convenient for getting to and from the airport. But if you're looking for a picturesque setting with great shopping malls and fine dining in the area, this may not be the place for you. The hotel is not in the gleaming, brand new section of Dubai. The surrounding neighborhood is clean, but definitely has a more "local" feel as opposed to feeling really tourist-y. We liked it, and found some great, inexpensive places to eat in the area. A tip-this hotel used to be called the "Highland Hotel" before it became a Howard Johnson, so a few of the cab drivers that we had knew it by that name. They didn't know where the Howard Johnson was, so it's good to have that other name handy to get to your destination faster.

Reviews.Title: “Homely stay”
Reviews.Author: pinarayi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my family from 16 Mar to 19 Mar 11 for leisure trip to Dubai. I felt the staff were excellent and very friendly. Rooms were very clean and very well maintained. The foods offered were very good and as per our expectation. I recommend any family to stay in this hotel and it really value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: peterkirchem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Johnson for 2 nights. Excellent hotel for the money. The room was clean, and a good size, the bath had all you needed, including a bath as well as a shower, the breakfast, although extra, was fine. As far as the location is concerned, I agree it is a bit out of town, but taxis as so cheap it really doesn't matter. Staff very helpful, you pay for WIFI, but so what? A great stay. Would return any time.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Hotel - Bur Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Khalid Bin Waleed St, Dubai 00971, United Arab Emirates
